summary: This is a service request form for programming and adding Vicon V942 IP cameras at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. The request was created on September 28, 2019, and assigned to technicians Jeff Cranor and Jeff McKenzie to assist with configuring camera ports for integration into a security system.

persons.name: Jeff Cranor
persons.context: Assigned technician to handle the service request for programming security cameras at the MCC New York facility.

persons.name: Jeff McKenzie
persons.context: Assigned technician alongside Jeff Cranor to handle the service request for programming security cameras at the MCC New York facility.

events.title: Camera Programming Service Request
events.description: A service request was created to program and add Vicon V942 IP cameras at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, requiring technicians to configure the correct ONVIF HTTP port number for system integration.

keyFacts: The document is a service request form related to security camera programming at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, where Jeffrey Epstein was held.
The request was created on September 28, 2019, which is after Epstein's death in August 2019, indicating ongoing facility maintenance.
The service involved programming Vicon V942 IP cameras to integrate with the Qognify/Sitebuilder security system using the correct ONVIF HTTP port.
The request was assigned to technicians Jeff Cranor and Jeff McKenzie with a scheduled appointment window of 8-11am on September 28, 2019.
The location specified is 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007, which is the address for the federal Metropolitan Correctional Center.
